/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ Kautsky described it as such, not Martov
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ The Terror was not the same as state terrorism (i.e. blowing up ordinary people), it was a ideological war against motivated counterrevolutionaries.
/* Assassination attempts */
rm POV pushing, Hitchens and Ticktin are also critics of Soviet repression
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ What Hitchens used to be irrelevant, we are getting into [[John Birch Society]] territory here.
/* Lenin and the Red Terror */ Added pioneering historian of the Red Terror Melgunov as source...
It's NPOV to describe Pipes as a vociferous [[anti-communist]] but POV to describe Manning Clark as a leftist? Please.... Attempting to fix and balance the mess created by this unregistered user.
"Anti-communist" is an accurate description not a term of abuse or POV, why do you regard it as a such? BTW, Hitchens hasn't been a Trotskyist for many years, he's now with Kristol, Wolfowitz, etc.
